td.h1: On-demand Secure Circuits and Advance Reservation System
td.div: In collaboration with the Internet2 BRUW Project

meta.title: On-demand Secure Circuits and Advance Reservation System

div.p: With the advent of service sensitive applications (such as remote- controlled experiments, time constrained massive data transfers, video-conferencing, etc.), it has become apparent that there is a need to augment the services present in today's ESnet infrastructure.

Two DOE Office of Science workshops in the past two years have clearly identified both science discipline driven network requirements and a roadmap for meeting these requirements. This project begins to address one element of the roadmap: dynamically provisioned, QoS paths.

The focus of the ESnet On-Demand Secure Circuits and Advance Reservation System (OSCARS) is to develop and deploy a prototype service that enables on-demand provisioning of guaranteed bandwidth secure circuits within ESnet.

ul.li: Chin Guok is the principal investigator and network engineer.
David Robertson is the main developer of the reservation manager component, and of corresponding Perl clients and tests and Web interfaces.
Mary Thompson is handling security and the service description, including interoperability issues.
Jason Lee is working on network issues and Java clients, including the use of signing.
Brian Tierney is working on network issues, including performance testing.
